content: The Bush Administration released The Budget of the U.S. Government, Fiscal Year 2008 on February 5, 2007, containing detailed budget information, policy proposals, and economic forecasts for FY2007 through FY2012. The budget documents also address long-term fiscal issues and historical budget data. The FY2008 budget resolution was adopted by Congress in May 2007, leading to the consideration of appropriation bills by the House and Senate committees. By August 5, all twelve regular appropriation bills for FY2008 had been passed by the House, with the Senate passing some bills in July and mid-September. In late July, all twelve regular appropriation bills for FY2008 cleared the House Appropriations Committee. By August 5, the House had passed all twelve bills, while the Senate passed some bills in July and mid-September. The Senate failed to pass the remaining eight bills by September 30.
